The [[Egypt|Egyptian]] [[presenter|television host]] and [[political commentator]] [[Emad Adeeb]] proposed in a phone call with the [[Al-Qahira Al-Youm]], then with the [[Al-Shorouk (Egyptian newspaper)|Al-Shorouk]] newspaper a constitutional formulations that would allow A Â«Safe ExistÂ» for Egyptian Presidents, so that Egypt will have former presidents and not only Former dead presidents.
â
He also propose to limit the presidency to two terms and no more, whether ''four and four'' or ''six and six''. And [[amend]] the [[constitution]] so as to allow genuine [[pluralism]] and prohibit the consumption of power and separation of powers between various forms of Government.
+
He also propose to limit the presidency to two terms and no more, whether ''four and four'' or ''six and six''. And [[Constitutional amendment|amend the constitution]] so as to allow genuine [[pluralism]] and prohibit the consumption of power and separation of powers between various forms of Government.
He added: Â«If there any hope that next line of presidents of Egypt will not belong to the "Solid Foundation" -- Represented in the military or intelligence or from The Egyptian Federal Bureau of Investigation -- It has to happen in the presence of President MubarakÂ». He also said Â«If fate decided that institutions of the State to choose a President in the absence of President Mubarak -- for any of the constitutional reasons set forth on the absence of the President -- It is certain in my mind that the next President of Egypt will be from the "Solid Foundation"Â».
He added: Â«If there any hope that next line of presidents of Egypt will not belong to the "Solid Foundation" -- Represented in the military or intelligence or from The Egyptian Federal Bureau of Investigation -- It has to happen in the presence of President MubarakÂ».
